question: Which of the following is an INCORRECT statement about Scaling, a design principle of Reliability pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
options: A scale out operation implies you scale by adding more instances to your existing pool of resources
Fault tolerance is achieved by a scale out operation
Fault tolerance is achieved by a scale up operation
A scale up operation implies you scale by adding more power (CPU, RAM) to your existing machine/node
correctAnswer: Fault tolerance is achieved by a scale up operation
explanation: A scale up operation is constrained to one computer, making it prone to failure. In contrast, scale out operations add instances, allowing distributed workloads and fault tolerance.

question: An e-commerce company has deployed an RDS database in a single Availability Zone (AZ). The engineering team wants to ensure that in case of an AZ outage, the database should continue working on the same endpoint without any manual administrative intervention. Which of the following solutions can address this use-case?
options: Provision the database via AWS CloudFormation
Configure the database in RDS Multi-AZ deployment with automatic failover to the standby
Deploy the database via AWS Elastic Beanstalk
Configure the database in RDS read replica mode with automatic failover to the standby
correctAnswer: Configure the database in RDS Multi-AZ deployment with automatic failover to the standby
explanation: RDS Multi-AZ deployment enables automatic failover to a standby in case of failure, providing continuous operation without endpoint change.

question: An IT company is planning to migrate from an on-premises environment to AWS Cloud. Which of the following expense areas would result in cost savings when the company moves to AWS Cloud? (Select two)
explanation: Migrating to AWS eliminates costs associated with physical infrastructure and its security.

question: Which of the following AWS services can be used to connect a company's on-premises environment to a VPC without using the public internet?
explanation: AWS Direct Connect establishes a private, high-bandwidth connection between your network and AWS without using the public internet.

question: A multi-national corporation wants to get expert professional advice on migrating to AWS and managing their applications on AWS Cloud. Which of the following entities would you recommend for this engagement?
explanation: APN Consulting Partners help customers design, architect, build, migrate, and manage workloads on AWS.

question: Which of the following is a benefit of using AWS managed services such as Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)?
options: The performance of AWS managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) instance is better than a customer-managed database instance
The customer needs to patch the underlying OS
There is no need to optimize database instance type and size
The customer needs to manage database backups
correctAnswer: The performance of AWS managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) instance is better than a customer-managed database instance
explanation: AWS RDS provides performance optimization with managed services for setup, backups, and patching.

question: A financial services company wants to ensure that its AWS account activity meets governance, compliance, and auditing norms. Which AWS service would you recommend for this use-case?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail logs account activity, providing event history for governance, compliance, and auditing.

question: Which of the following is CORRECT regarding removing an AWS account from AWS Organizations?
options: The AWS account must be able to operate as a standalone account. Only then it can be removed from AWS organizations
The AWS account must not have any Service Control Policies (SCPs) attached to it. Only then it can be removed from AWS organizations
Raise a support ticket with AWS Support to remove the account
The AWS account can be removed from AWS Systems Manager
correctAnswer: The AWS account must be able to operate as a standalone account. Only then it can be removed from AWS organizations
explanation: An account must meet requirements for standalone operation to leave an AWS Organization.

question: A multi-national company has just moved its infrastructure from its on-premises data center to AWS Cloud. As part of the shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for which of the following?
options: Service and Communications Protection or Zone Security
explanation: AWS handles physical infrastructure security under the shared responsibility model.

question: Which of the following AWS Support plans provide access to only core checks from the AWS Trusted Advisor Best Practice Checks? (Select two)
explanation: AWS Basic and Developer Support plans provide core Trusted Advisor checks for best practices.

question: Which of the following are the advantages of cloud computing? (Select three)
options: Benefit from massive economies of scale
Trade capital expense for variable expense
Go global in minutes and deploy applications in multiple regions around the world with just a few clicks
Allocate a few months of planning for your infrastructure capacity needs
Spend money on building and maintaining data centers
Trade variable expense for capital expense
correctAnswer: Benefit from massive economies of scale
Trade capital expense for variable expense
Go global in minutes and deploy applications in multiple regions around the world with just a few clicks
explanation: Cloud computing offers benefits like cost efficiency, scalability, and global reach.

question: Which of the following statements are CORRECT regarding the AWS VPC service? (Select two)
options: A Network Address Translation instance (NAT instance) is managed by AWS
A Network Address Translation gateway (NAT gateway) is managed by AWS
A Security Group can have allow rules only
A Security Group can have both allow and deny rules
A network access control list (network ACL) can have allow rules only
correctAnswer: A Network Address Translation gateway (NAT gateway) is managed by AWS
A Security Group can have allow rules only
explanation: AWS manages NAT gateways, while Security Groups can only allow rules and operate at the instance level.

question: Which of the following are examples of Horizontal Scalability (aka Elasticity)? (Select two)
options: Add a bigger CPU to a computer
Read Replicas in Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
Modify an EC2 instance type from t2.nano to u-12tb1.metal
Modify a Database instance to higher CPU and RAM
correctAnswer: Read Replicas in Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
explanation: Horizontal scalability involves adding more instances or resources, as seen in Elastic Load Balancing and RDS Read Replicas.

question: Which of the following AWS services are always free to use (Select two)?
options: AWS Identity and Access Management (AWS IAM)
correctAnswer: AWS Identity and Access Management (AWS IAM)
explanation: IAM and Auto Scaling are available at no additional charge, while EC2 and S3 incur costs based on usage.

question: Which characteristic of Cloud Computing imparts the ability to acquire resources as you need and release when you no longer need them?
explanation: Elasticity enables scaling resources up or down dynamically as needed.

question: Which tool will help you review your workloads against current AWS best practices for cost optimization, security, and performance improvement and then obtain advice to architect them better?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations based on best practices to optimize costs, improve performance, and enhance security.

question: Which of the following AWS services is essential for implementing security of resources in AWS Cloud?
explanation: IAM enables secure management of AWS resources with controlled access permissions.

question: Which of the following AWS services comes under the Software as a Service (SaaS) Cloud Computing Type?
explanation: Amazon Rekognition is a SaaS service, offering image and video analysis.

question: Which AWS service publishes up-to-the-minute information on the general status and availability of all AWS services in all the Regions of AWS Cloud?
options: AWS Health Dashboard â€“ Your account health
explanation: AWS Health Dashboard - service health provides information on AWS services' general status and availability across all regions.

question: The AWS Well-Architected Framework provides guidance on building cloud-based applications using AWS best practices. Which of the following options are the pillars mentioned in the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Select two)
explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Framework pillars include Cost Optimization and Reliability among others for building robust applications.

question: Which service gives a personalized view of the status of the AWS services that are part of your Cloud architecture so that you can quickly assess the impact on your business when AWS service(s) are experiencing issues?
options: AWS Health - Your Account Health Dashboard
correctAnswer: AWS Health - Your Account Health Dashboard
explanation: AWS Health - Your Account Health Dashboard provides alerts and remediation guidance when AWS is experiencing events that may impact you. With AWS Health - Your Account Health Dashboard, alerts are triggered by changes in the health of your AWS resources, giving you event visibility and guidance to help quickly diagnose and resolve issues. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/health/latest/ug/what-is-aws-health.html

question: An organization deploys its IT infrastructure in a combination of its on-premises data center along with AWS Cloud. How would you categorize this deployment model?
explanation: A hybrid deployment is a way to connect your on-premises infrastructure to the cloud. This approach extends an organization's infrastructure into the cloud while connecting cloud resources to internal systems. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/types-of-cloud-computing/

question: Which policy describes prohibited uses of the web services offered by Amazon Web Services?
explanation: The AWS Acceptable Use Policy describes prohibited uses of AWS services and is updated as needed by AWS. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/aup/

question: Multi-AZ deployment is an example of which of the following?
explanation: Running instances across multiple Availability Zones (AZs) allows applications to remain available during outages in any single AZ, which helps achieve high availability. Reference: https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wat.concept.availability.en.html

question: Which AWS technology/service helps you to scale your resources to match supply with demand while still keeping your cloud solution cost-effective?
explanation: AWS Auto Scaling automatically adjusts capacity to maintain steady, predictable performance at the lowest possible cost, making scaling simple across multiple AWS services. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/

question: Which feature of AWS Cloud offers the ability to innovate faster and rapidly develop, test and launch software applications?
options: Ability to deploy globally in minutes
explanation: Agility refers to the ability of the cloud to give you easy access to a broad range of technologies so that you can innovate faster and build nearly anything you can imagine. You can quickly spin up resources as needed, from infrastructure services to Internet of Things, machine learning, data lakes, and analytics. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/what-is-cloud-computing/

question: A company is looking for a guided path to help deploy, configure, and secure its new workloads while ensuring that it is ready for ongoing operations in the cloud. Which of the following AWS services/tools can be leveraged for this use case?
explanation: Cloud Foundations provides a guided path to help customers deploy, configure, and secure their new workloads while ensuring they are ready for ongoing operations in the cloud. It helps customers navigate through decision-making with curated AWS Services, AWS Solutions, Partner Solutions, and Guidance. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/architecture/cloud-foundations/

question: Which of the following Cloud Computing models does the 'gmail' service represent?
explanation: Software as a Service (SaaS) provides a complete product that is run and managed by the service provider, allowing users to use the software without managing the infrastructure. Gmail is an example of SaaS. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/types-of-cloud-computing/

question: An organization maintains separate Amazon Virtual Private Clouds (Amazon VPC) for each of its departments. With expanding business, the organization now wants to connect all Amazon VPCs for better departmental collaboration. Which AWS service will help the organization tackle the issue effectively?
explanation: AWS Transit Gateway connects Amazon VPCs and on-premises networks through a central hub, simplifying network management and reducing the need for complex peering relationships. It acts as a cloud router, allowing each new connection to be made only once. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/transit-gateway/

question: Which of the following is a part of the AWS Global Infrastructure?
explanation: AWS Region is a physical location where AWS builds its data centers, consisting of multiple, isolated Availability Zones (AZs) within a geographic area. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/

question: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework recommends maintaining infrastructure as code (IaC)?
explanation: The Operational Excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework includes the ability to run and monitor systems to deliver business value and improve processes. Infrastructure as Code (IaC) is a best practice in this pillar. Reference: https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wat.pillar.operationalExcellence.en.html

question: Which of the following is a perspective of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF)?
explanation: AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) groups its capabilities in six perspectives: Business, People, Governance, Platform, Security, and Operations. These perspectives help organizations successfully adopt cloud technologies. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/enterprise/

question: An IT company is on a cost-optimization spree and wants to identify all Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances that are under-utilized. Which AWS services can be used off-the-shelf to address this use-case without needing any manual configurations? (Select two)
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations for cost optimization and other areas, while AWS Cost Explorer includes rightsizing recommendations to identify cost-saving opportunities by downsizing or terminating underutilized Amazon EC2 instances. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

question: A development team is looking for a forum where the most frequent questions and requests from AWS customers are listed along with AWS provided solutions. Which AWS forum/service can be used for troubleshooting an issue or checking for a solution?
explanation: AWS Knowledge Center contains common questions and AWS-provided solutions, making it a useful resource for troubleshooting issues or checking for solutions to common problems. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/

question: The DevOps team at a Big Data consultancy has set up Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances across two AWS Regions for its flagship application. Which of the following characterizes this application architecture?
options: Deploying the application across two AWS Regions improves scalability
Deploying the application across two AWS Regions improves agility
Deploying the application across two AWS Regions improves availability
Deploying the application across two AWS Regions improves security
correctAnswer: Deploying the application across two AWS Regions improves availability
explanation: Deploying across multiple AWS Regions improves availability, as it enables the application to withstand regional failures and continue operating. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/

question: Which benefit of Cloud Computing allows AWS to offer lower pay-as-you-go prices as usage from hundreds of thousands of customers is aggregated in the cloud?
options: Trade capital expense for variable expense
explanation: Massive economies of scale allow AWS to reduce costs by aggregating usage from thousands of customers, resulting in lower variable costs for pay-as-you-go services. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

question: A cargo shipping company runs its server fleet on Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances. Some of these instances host the CRM (Customer Relationship Management) applications that need to be accessible 24/7. These applications are not mission-critical. In case of a disaster, these applications can be managed on a lesser number of instances for some time. Which disaster recovery strategy is well-suited as well as cost-effective for this requirement?
explanation: The Warm Standby strategy provides a functional but reduced-capacity setup, allowing applications to handle limited traffic during a disaster. This makes it cost-effective and suitable for applications that are not mission-critical. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/architecture/disaster-recovery-dr-architecture-on-aws-part-iii-pilot-light-and-warm-standby/

question: Which of the following entities are part of an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) in the AWS Cloud? (Select two)
explanation: Amazon VPC includes components like Internet Gateways, which enable internet access, and Subnets, which define IP address ranges within the VPC. Reference: https://docs.amazonaws.cn/en_us/vpc/latest/userguide/what-is-amazon-vpc.html

question: Which of the following are the serverless computing services offered by AWS? (Select two)
explanation: AWS Lambda and AWS Fargate are serverless computing services that allow users to run code or containers without managing the underlying server infrastructure. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/serverless/

question: Which of the following AWS storage services can be directly used with on-premises systems?
explanation: Amazon EFS provides a managed elastic NFS file system for use with both AWS services and on-premises resources, accessible via AWS Direct Connect or AWS VPN. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/efs/faq/

question: An organization maintains a separate Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) for each of its business units. Two units need to privately share data. Which is the most optimal way of privately sharing data between the two VPCs?
explanation: A VPC peering connection is a networking connection that enables private communication between two VPCs. Instances in either VPC can communicate with each other as if they are within the same network. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/peering/what-is-vpc-peering.html

question: Which of the following entities can be used to connect to an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) server from a Mac OS, Windows, or Linux-based computer via a browser-based client?
explanation: Amazon EC2 Instance Connect provides a secure way to connect to your instances using SSH and supports browser-based client connections from Mac OS, Windows, or Linux. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Connect-using-EC2-Instance-Connect.html

question: Which pillar of AWS Well-Architected Framework is responsible for making sure that you select the right resource types and sizes based on your workload requirements?
explanation: The Performance Efficiency pillar focuses on using computing resources efficiently, including selecting the right resource types and sizes based on workload requirements. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/architecture/well-architected/

question: Which entity ensures that your application on Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) always has the right amount of capacity to handle the current traffic demand?
explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances in response to traffic demand, ensuring sufficient capacity to handle the load. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/ec2/userguide/what-is-amazon-ec2-auto-scaling.html

question: An e-commerce company has migrated its IT infrastructure from the on-premises data center to AWS Cloud. Which of the following costs is the company responsible for?
options: Costs for powering servers on AWS Cloud
AWS Data Center physical security costs
Costs for hardware infrastructure on AWS Cloud
explanation: In a cloud environment, AWS is responsible for infrastructure-related costs like powering servers and physical security. However, customers are responsible for software licensing and human resource costs. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/what-is-cloud-computing.html

question: Which of the following is the best practice for application architecture on AWS Cloud?
explanation: AWS recommends using loosely coupled components, enabling scalability, flexibility, and faster development by organizing applications as small, independent microservices. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/compute/understanding-asynchronous-messaging-for-microservices/

question: A multi-national organization has a separate virtual private cloud (VPC) for each of its business units on the AWS Cloud. The organization also wants to connect its on-premises data center with the different virtual private clouds (VPC) for better organization-wide collaboration. Which AWS services can be combined to build the MOST efficient solution for this use-case? (Select two)
explanation: AWS Transit Gateway acts as a central hub to connect multiple VPCs, while AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated, private connection between on-premises infrastructure and AWS. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/transit-gateway/

question: A company needs to keep sensitive data in its own data center due to compliance but would still like to deploy resources using AWS. Which Cloud deployment model does this refer to?
explanation: Hybrid Cloud allows integration between on-premises infrastructure and cloud-based resources, ideal for companies needing to keep sensitive data on-premises while using cloud services. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/types-of-cloud-computing/

question: Adding more CPU/RAM to an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance represents which of the following?
explanation: Vertical scaling involves adding resources such as CPU or RAM to a single instance, increasing performance without adding new instances. Reference: https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wat.concept.horizontal-scaling.en.html

question: Which of the following options are the benefits of using AWS Elastic Load Balancing (ELB)? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, enhancing both high availability and fault tolerance. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

question: Which Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) Auto Scaling feature can help with fault tolerance?
options: Lower cost by adjusting the number of Amazon EC2 instances
Having the right amount of computing capacity
Distributing load to Amazon EC2 instances
explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling can detect unhealthy instances, terminate them, and replace them with new ones, which helps maintain fault tolerance. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/autoscaling/

question: According to the AWS Well-Architected Framework, which of the following statements are recommendations in the Operational Excellence pillar? (Select two)
explanation: The Operational Excellence pillar emphasizes making frequent, small, reversible changes and anticipating failure to improve system resilience and response. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/architecture/well-architected/

question: A cyber forensics team has detected that AWS-owned IP addresses are being used to carry out malicious attacks. As this constitutes prohibited use of AWS services, which of the following is the correct solution to address this issue?
options: Write an email to Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon, with the details of the incident
explanation: The AWS Abuse Team handles incidents involving abusive use of AWS resources, including malicious attacks originating from AWS IP addresses. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/report-aws-abuse/

question: AWS Web Application Firewall (WAF) offers protection from common web exploits at which layer?
explanation: AWS WAF protects against web exploits at the Application layer (Layer 7), monitoring HTTP and HTTPS requests forwarded to Amazon CloudFront, API Gateway, or an Application Load Balancer. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/developerguide/what-is-aws-waf.html

question: A company wants to have control over creating and using its own keys for encryption on AWS services. Which of the following can be used for this use-case?
explanation: Customer managed keys (CMKs) allow users full control over encryption keys, including creation, management, and deletion, making them ideal for this use case. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kms/latest/developerguide/concepts.html#master_keys

question: Which of the following is a recommended way to provide programmatic access to AWS resources?
options: Use AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (AWS MFA) to access AWS resources programmatically
Use Access Key ID and Secret Access Key to access AWS resources programmatically
Create a new IAM user and share the username and password
Use IAM user group to access AWS resources programmatically
correctAnswer: Use Access Key ID and Secret Access Key to access AWS resources programmatically
explanation: Access Key ID and Secret Access Key provide long-term credentials for programmatic access via the AWS CLI or SDKs. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_access-keys.html

question: A web application stores all of its data on Amazon S3 buckets. A client has mandated that data be encrypted before sending it to Amazon S3. Which of the following is the right technique for encrypting data as needed by the customer?
options: Enable client-side encryption using AWS encryption SDK
Enable server-side encryption with Amazon S3 Managed Keys (SSE-S3)
Encryption is enabled by default for all the objects written to Amazon S3. Additional configuration is not required
Enable server-side encryption with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) keys (SSE-KMS)
correctAnswer: Enable client-side encryption using AWS encryption SDK
explanation: Client-side encryption using AWS Encryption SDK allows data to be encrypted before it is sent to Amazon S3, fulfilling the client's requirement. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/en_us/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/UsingClientSideEncryption.html

question: AWS Shield Advanced provides expanded DDoS attack protection for web applications running on which of the following resources? (Select two)
explanation: AWS Shield Advanced provides enhanced DDoS protection for resources such as Amazon Route 53 and AWS Global Accelerator, mitigating network, transport, and application layer attacks. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/developerguide/ddos-overview.html

question: Which of the following AWS services support VPC Endpoint Gateway for a private connection from a VPC? (Select two)
explanation: Amazon S3 and Amazon DynamoDB support VPC Gateway Endpoints, allowing private connectivity from a VPC to these services without the need for an internet gateway. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/vpc-endpoints.html

question: Which security service of AWS is enabled for all AWS customers, by default, at no additional cost?
explanation: AWS Shield Standard provides basic DDoS protection to all AWS customers at no additional cost, covering network and transport layer attacks. Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/developerguide/shield-chapter.html

question: A company runs an application on a fleet of EC2 instances. The company wants to automate the traditional maintenance job of running timely assessments and checking for OS vulnerabilities. As a Cloud Practitioner, which service will you suggest for this use case?
explanation: Amazon Inspector is an automated security assessment service that helps identify OS vulnerabilities and deviations from best practices on EC2 instances. Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/inspector/
